info.title: CCP Interface Description
info.description:
The interfaces of the Contract Certificate Pool (CCP) are used to request the provisioning of Contract Data. It accepts Contract Data signed by a CPS. Optionally the data can be forwarded to the CCP directly by the CPS. 

This service provides the following interfaces:
 * Get Signed Contract Data
 * Provide Signed Contract Data
 * Delete Signed Contract Data
 * Get Contracts for PCID
 * Lookup Contract
 * Define Contract as Default for Offline installation
 * Add Signed Contract Data




### Clients

The CCP communicates with the following actors and services:

 * The _Mobility Operator_ calls the CCP API actively to send Signed Contract Data.
 * The _Contract Provisioning Service_ forwards Signed Contract Data to the CCP.
 * The _CPO_ both send CertificateInstallationRequests to receive 
CertificateInstallationResponses
 * The _OEM_ request CertificateInstallationRequests via PCID and EMAID to receive 
CertificateInstallationResponses
 * OCSP Responders of the Contract Certificates
 * Root Certificate Pool

post.description:
This interface delivers signed contract data to CPO backend. The CPO is sending the `certificateInstallationReqest` created by the vehicle to the CCP. The CCP will reply with a `certificateInstallationResponse` to be forwarded to the vehicle.

> #### CPS Signer 
> The CCP will send regarding the provided V2G Roots installed in the EV (certificateInstallationReqest) the regarding signed contract data back as certificateInstallationResponse

parameters.name: alwaysReturnEXI
parameters.description: To receive a ISO15118 response even for error cases, set this parameter to true
if set to true - this call is not getting forwarded to other Ecosystems
parameters.name: broadcast

put.summary: Add Signed Contract Data to CCP

errorMessages: The validUntil date of contract certificate is in the past.

put.description: This interface can be used by a CPS to send signed contract data to the Contract Certificate Pool. It is stored there to be provided to the OEM and CPO backend.

errorMessages: The contract for the given EMAID not found.

delete.description:
The deletion of signed contract data from the CCP can be used to de-publish it by the MO. A revoked or expired contract certificate will be cleaned from the pool automatically. See the section [Data Cleansing in the CCP description](#contract-certificate-pool).

The PCP calls this method when a Provisioning Certificate has been deleted. See `DELETE /oem/provCerts/{pcid}` for more details.


### Data validation steps

The Contract Certificate Pool performs the following validation steps before deleting signed contract data.

| Target                   | Check                        |             
|--------------------------|----------------------------- |
| Authorization            | Sender must be allowed to delete contract data for the given EMAID. |
| Request Parameter        | The EMAID must be provided.                                
| Request Parameter        | The EMAID must match the specification                     |
| Request Parameter        | The EMAID must reference an existing contract data package.  |


## Automatic revocation

<!-- theme: warning -->

> If the Contract Certificate has been issued by a Operator-operated MO CA, the certificate will be revoked automatically. This functionality can be turned of by setting the `X-Skip-Revocation` header to `true`. This is not recommended and should just be used for test cases!

The procedure for this functionality is:

1. CCP receives a DELETE for a EMAID.
2. The CCP checks if the related Contract Certificated has been issued by a Operator MO V2G CA
3. If so, the CCP sends a revocation request to the issuing CA.
4. On successful revocation the Contract Data will be deleted from the pool. On error the Contract Data remains in the pool and an error message is returned.

parameters.name: X-Skip-Revocation
parameters.description: Do not revoke the contract certificate.

parameters.name: emaid
parameters.description: The EMAID of the requested contract.

errorMessages: Invalid SessionID format, make sure the length is maximum 8 characters and it is represented in HEX binary
The contract for the given EMAID not found.

get.description:
The CCP offers this additional interface to provide signed contract data to OEM backends without the need of a CertificateInstallationRequest. The OEM backend requests the endpoint with an EMAID and a PCID to receive the certificateInstallationResponse.

The OEM backend must check the validity of the contract, before the installation into the car, whether it is expired or revoked.

| Check                                            | 
|--------------------------------------------------|
| Contract for EMAID must be existing in the pool. |

parameters.name: sessionID
parameters.description: Session ID as HEX shall be included into the xml if present

parameters.name: xsdMsgDefNamespace
parameters.description: To receive signed contract data for a specific ISO Version

parameters.name: cpsRootCertificateId
parameters.description: The UUID of the used CPS V2G-Root CA, if not set, the latest contract data  will be replied

parameters.name: emaid
parameters.description: The EMAID of the requested contract.

put.summary: Define Contract as Default for Offline installation
put.description:
The CCP offers this additional interface to set an existing signed contract data as default. A starred Contract-Data will always be send in the CertificateInstallationRequest. The OEM will requests the endpoint to mark a contract as default for a PCID for an offline installation.

| Prio                                            | 
|--------------------------------------------------|
| The first created Contract will be always the default |
| If a default contract gets deleted, the contract with the lowest prio number (1-is default) gets the new default contract - an notification will be send to the OEM  (not yet implemented)|

get.description: The MO sends a request to the Contract Certificate Pool (CCP) to check the availability of the contract for the requested EMAID.

parameters.name: xsdMsgDefNamespace
parameters.description: to receive contract data for a specific ISO version

parameters.name: cpsRootCertificateId
parameters.description: The UUID of the used CPS V2G-Root CA, if not set, the latest contract data  will be replied

get.description: Lists available contract data for a given PCID.

parameters.description: to receive contract data for a specific ISO version

certificateInstallationRes.description: Base64 encoded EXI - Contract installation response as defined in the ISO15118 standard

cpsRootCertificateId.description: The UUID of the root CA which was used to sign this contract data (regarding CPS signing certificate)

ProvideContractDataResponse.title: ProvideSignedContractDataResponse
ProvideContractDataResponse.description: Contains a prepared certificateInstallationResponse without the checks defined in [V2G2-894]. These checks need to be performed by the OEM before forwarding the response to the vehicle.

certificateInstallationRes.description: Base64 encoded EXI - Contract installation response as defined in the ISO15118 standard

cpsRootCertificateId.description: The UUID of the root CA which was used to sign this contract data (regarding CPS signing certificate)

XMLContracts.cpsRootDistinguishedName: "CN=V2G Root CA QA G1, DC=V2G, O=Hubject GmbH, C=DE"

contractCertificate.description: Contract Certificate in base64 encoded DER form

defaultContract.description: If set to true it will get delivered as certificateInstallationResponse. the value is defined by the OEM/User if multiple contracts are stored in the CCP for one PCID.

certValidFrom.description: Valid From Date and Time of contract certificate

certValidTo.description: Valid to Date and Time of contract certificate

cpsRootCertificateId.description: The UUID of the root CA which was used to sign this contract data (regarding CPS signing certificate)

cpsRootDistinguishedName.description: Reflects the subjects distinguished name of the used V2G Root PKI. (informative)
cpsRootDistinguishedName.example: "CN=V2G Root CA QA G1, DC=V2G, O=Hubject GmbH, C=DE"

signedContractDataXML.description: XML in base64 encoding, as generated by the Certificate Provisioning Service.

cpsRootCertificateId.description: The UUID of the root CA which was used to sign this contract data (regarding CPS signing certificate)
